body.p: I can certify to the truth of the statements contained in the foregoing affidavit. It was proved that a glass of liquor had been sold -- and no proof other than this one selling was adduced -- at affiants house, "the Clinton Hotel", to one Thomas Dickey, during the Christmas holidays of 1863. It was also proved that Dickey was one and twenty years of age on February 6th 1864; on about 5 weeks after he was alleged to have done the drinking. Also that Dickey had been for some time doing business -- buying and selling -- and making contracts in his own name It neither appeared that he had a parent or authorized guardian. He was to all appearances a man aged at least 21 years; had a beard, and the size, mien and bearing of a man fully grown. I am satisfied affiant was deceived by the circumstances above indicated; and violated a penal law without intending so to do. The character of affiant as a man and hotel-keeper is good. The case, it seems to me, merits Executive clemency
